sentence.Network_en: There has been a sharp slowdown in economic growth.
sentence.Network_cn: 经济增长的速度明显放慢。

sentence.Network_cn: 要估算出究竟多少高级职员参与了怠工是不可能的。

entry.def: A slowdown is a reduction in speed or activity.

example.ex: There has been a sharp slowdown in economic growth.
example.tran: 经济增长的速度明显放慢。

entry.def: A slowdown is a protest in which workers deliberately work slowly and cause problems for their employers.

example.ex: It's impossible to assess how many officers are participating in the slowdown.
example.tran: 要估算出究竟多少高级职员参与了怠工是不可能的。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of slowing down or falling behind

auth_sentence.content: Even the most optimistic analysts forecast a serious slowdown.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even the most optimistic analysts forecast a serious slowdown.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even the most optimistic analysts forecast a serious slowdown.

auth_sentence.content: We are going to have some kind of slowdown.
auth_sentence.res_content: We are going to have some kind of slowdown.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We are going to have some kind of slowdown.

sentences.en: The slowdown in domestic demand was offset by an increase in exports.
sentences.cn: 国内需求放缓和出口增长互相抵消了。

sentences.en: The union threatened a slowdown if their demands were not met.
sentences.cn: 工会威胁说如果不答应他们的要求,他们就怠工。
